results.name: a(n) = A156552(n) mod 3.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
mathematica: Array[Mod[#, 3] &@ Floor@ Total@ Flatten@ MapIndexed[#1 2^(#2 - 1) &, Flatten[Table[2^(PrimePi@ #1 - 1), {#2}] & @@@ FactorInteger@ #]] &, 105] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 27 2019 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 08 2019
